awd_titl_txt: Mathematical Sciences: Mathematical Models of Drug Transportin Brain Tissue
awd_abstract_narration: This award provides funds for the support of two                           undergraduates working with the principal investigator on                       mathematical problems arising in the modeling of transport of                   medical drugs within brain tissue.  The models will be designed                 to explain the types of transport (convection, diffusion or                     absorption) by which a drug may spread from an injection site                   into the brain.  Students will concentrate on developing the                    appropriate mathematical analysis necessary to formulate the                    model through their studies of systems of nonlinear equations,                  regularity of solutions of the heat equation and the application                of multivariate analysis to regression.  Work will also be done                 on the design of experimental computational schemes for testing                 various models                                                                       Although the students will use data derived from live                      experiments, their work consists solely of mathematical modeling                and mathematical analysis.
org_dir_long_name: Directorate for Mathematical and Physical Sciences
